member.name: T:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor
member.summary:
Contains flags set by the meaningful comparer methods. This is necessary to ensure that crackers have not cut out the entry point of the verification algorithm located in LicenseCore.VerifySignature() and all the methods have been called. The flags should be set by 3 comparer methods subsequently, each method must check if the previous method has been invoked.
Also see SignatureInvalidFlag in this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.Clear
member.summary: Made accessible so license unit tests can reset the static state properly.

member.name: M:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked
member.summary: Returns 0x100 if all methods have been invoked properly, returns 0x1000 otherwise.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag
member.summary:
If EnsureIfAllMethodsInvoked says that verification methods were called and SignatureInvalidFlag is zero, then the signature was verified and it was correct.
This is set to greater than zero if signature verification failed at some stage.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag1
member.summary: Used for checking if methods 1 and 2 were invoked. Initial value = 0x30. Method 1 must check it and if it is 0x30, set it to 0xff, otherwise leave intact. Method 2 then must check it and if it is 0xff, set it to 0x80, otherwise leave intact.

member.name: P:Aspose.License.Hackers.VerificationSupervisor.MethodCalledFlag2
member.summary: Used for checking if method 3 was invoked. Initial value = true. Method 3 must set it to false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.License.SetLicense(System.String)

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:

ms.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

java.p: 2. The folder that contains the Aspose component JAR file.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling JAR file.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")
the component jar file:
License license = new License(); license.setLicense("MyLicense.lic"); Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore
member.summary: The actual code of the license class is put into an internal class and made into long functions to make it harder for the crackers to find anything meaningful after the dlls were cracked in November 2005.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.AsposeDot
member.summary: Used in the product mapping to build full product name. This is to avoid other developers accidentally damaging this code when doing global rename.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.GetLicenseState
member.summary: Call this from your component code to check if running evaluation version or not.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.CheckEdition(Aspose.Imaging.EditionType,System.String)
member.summary:
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.
Call this when the user attempts to use a feature that is limited by edition type. Throws a message explaining the license limitation to the user.
member.remarks: Most of Aspose products are supposed to have just one edition type. Only complex products might have two edition types. When using two edition types, make sure it is easy for the client to select edition type they need.
member.param: Specify edition type that is required to access your feature.
Message that explains what feature the user is trying to access.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.Xml.XmlDocument)
member.summary:
Verifies the signature on the XML file and loads it into the license files, but does not check them. Made internal only for unit testing, do not call directly otherwise.
Note, this function was manually tuned (made complex) so it does not decompile in Reflector.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.MapOldProductName(System.String)
member.summary: In January 2006 product names such as Aspose Word, Aspose Excel etc had to be changed. This function maps these product names so old licenses can be used in new products.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.LoadLicense(System.String)
member.summary: See above. Use for unit testing only.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.VerifySignature(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary:
Verifies that content of the data element has not been tampered with. Safe to pass nulls.
Note there is no direct action taken inside this method if the signature is invalid. If the signature is invalid, the VerificationSupervisor.SignatureInvalidFlag is set to greater than zero and you need to examine it somewhere later in your code. This is to confuse hackers.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LicenseCore.ProbeLicense(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Tries to find the license in several locations: 1. Explicit path. 2. The folder of this assembly. 3. The folder of the client's calling assembly. 4. The folder of the entry assembly (does not apply for the .NET Compact Framework). 5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
member.param: This can be full or short file name or name of an embedded resource.
Client's calling assembly. Used to find license in embedded resource.
member.returns: Returns a stream that contains the license or throws.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.Blend
member.summary: Defines a blend pattern. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The typical blend class usage is defining a blend pattern for brush. And thus the blend properties should be initialized carefully. Null arrays are not allowed. The brush will throw the appropriate exception if blend factors or positions array are empty or their length is not the same. If there are two or more elements in the positions array then the first element should be 0 and the last should be 1.

member.summary: Saves (copies) the stream's data to the specified stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.Cache.ExactReallocateOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether reallocation should be exact or not. If reallocation is non exact the performance should be higher.
member.value: true if reallocation is exact; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The exact reallocation will perform reallocation of additional memory only up to the upper limit specified. When passing upper limit for in-memory during reallocation the cached data will be copied to disk if possible. When passing upper limit for disk memory during reallocation the appropriate exception is thrown. The performance should be higher if this option is turned off as no additional copying will be performed if possible, however this may also lead to pass upper limits specified for memory or disk.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.ColorConverters.MapColorConverterDiffBits.ConversionMap
member.summary: The conversion map. A single dimension array is used to speed up conversion process. Single dimension array read/write operations are much faster than jagged or multidimensional. This leads to more complex understanding but faster performance. When second dimensions is required we use +256 indexes, for third +512 and so on.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.ColorPaletteCacher.SortedPaletteValue.EqualValueReference
member.summary: The equal value reference is circular reference to the palette entries where the same grayscale value resides. This can help in cases where we reference another RGB color (both have same grayscale) For example we may have the following palette values: 0 R=10 G=0 B=0 grayscale=10 (EqualValueReference = 1, we reference next element) 1 R=0 G=10 B=0 grayscale=10 (EqualValueReference = 2, we reference next element) 2 R=0 G=0 B=10 grayscale=10 (EqualValueReference = 0, we reference first element) By default EqualValueReference is referencing itself conforming an endless loop.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.CrcCalculatorStream
member.summary: A Stream that calculates a CRC32 (a checksum) on all bytes read, or on all bytes written.

remarks.para: This class can be used to verify the CRC of a ZipEntry when reading from a stream, or to calculate a CRC when writing to a stream. The stream should be used to either read, or write, but not both. If you intermix reads and writes, the results are not defined.
This class is intended primarily for use internally by the DotNetZip library.

member.summary: The number of bytes available in the InputBuffer, starting at NextIn.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.Message
member.summary: used for diagnostics, when something goes wrong!

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.compressLevel
member.summary: The compression level to use in this codec. Useful only in compression mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.WindowBits
member.summary: The number of Window Bits to use.
member.remarks: This gauges the size of the sliding window, and hence the compression effectiveness as well as memory consumption. It's best to just leave this setting alone if you don't know what it is. The maximum value is 15 bits, which implies a 32k window.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.Strategy
member.remarks: This is only effective in compression. The theory offered by ZLIB is that different strategies could potentially produce significant differences in compression behavior for different data sets. Unfortunately I don't have any good recommendations for how to set it differently. When I tested changing the strategy I got minimally different compression performance. It's best to leave this property alone if you don't have a good feel for it. Or, you may want to produce a test harness that runs through the different strategy options and evaluates them on different file types. If you do that, let me know your results.

whether to emit an initial RFC1950 byte pair in the compressed stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.EndDeflate

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Compressors.ZLibEncoder.ResetDeflate
member.summary: Reset a codec for another deflation session.
member.remarks: Call this to reset the deflation state. For example if a thread is deflating non-consecutive blocks, you can call Reset() after the Deflate(Sync) of the first block and before the next Deflate(None) of the second block.

member.summary: The compression level to use in this codec. Useful only in compression mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.DataRecoveryMode.None
member.summary: No data recovery is implied. Whenever the file format has some corrupted data the appropriate exception is thrown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.DataRecoveryMode.ConsistentRecover
member.summary: The consistent recovery mode tries to recover all data as long as corruption does not break the file format and allows correct further processing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.DataRecoveryMode.MaximalRecover
member.summary: The maximal recovery mode recovers all data even if the file format has corrupted structure and further processing may yield unattended effects.

member.summary: Boehm's algorithm of insertion of a knots and control point inside curve.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exporters.CadSplineHelper.KnotParameter.Chord
member.summary: Chord-Length method. Spaces the knots connecting each component curve to be proportional to the distances between each associated pair of fit points. An example is the green curve in the illustration.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exporters.CadSplineHelper.KnotParameter.SquareRoot
member.summary: Centripetal method. Spaces the knots connecting each component curve to be proportional to the square root of the distance between each associated pair of fit points. This method usually produces “gentler” curves.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exporters.CadSplineHelper.KnotParameter.Uniform
member.summary: Equidistant method. Spaces the knots of each component curve to be equal, regardless of the spacing of the fit points. This method often produces curves that overshoot the fit points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exporters.CadSplineHelper.KnotParameter.Custom
member.summary: If the spline does not have fit data, then the knot parameter should become Custom.

member.param: Optional slope constraint for the first point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
Optional slope constraint for the final point. Single.NaN means no constraint.
member.exception: startSlope and endSlope cannot be infinity.

member.param: Input. X coordinates to evaluate the fitted curve at.
member.returns: The computed y values for each x.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Exporters.CadSplineHelper.CubicSplineInterpolation.GetNextXIndex(System.Double)
member.summary: Find where in xyOrig the specified x falls, by simultaneous traverse. This allows xs to be less than x[0] and/or greater than x[n-1]. So allows extrapolation. This keeps state, so requires that x be sorted and xs called in ascending order.

member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.summary: Represents the color type where each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk shall appear.

member.summary: The null-filter, means no filtering for image data rows.

member.summary: The sub filter, means substractive filtering will be applied to image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Up

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Avg
member.summary: The avg filter, means, that average filter will be applied to image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Png.PngFilterType.Adaptive
member.summary: Adaptive filtering, means that saving process will choose most sutable filter for each data row. Best compression, slowest execution time.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.StreamContainer.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.StreamContainer.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter. This value represents offset from the starting stream position passed in the StreamContainer constructor.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.

The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix
member.summary: a Three-diagonal matrix has non-zero entries only on the main diagonal, the diagonal above the main (super), and the diagonal below the main (sub).

remarks.para: This is based on the wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tridiagonal_matrix_algorithm

The entries in the matrix on a particular row are a[i], b[i], and c[i] where i is the row index. b is the main diagonal, and so for an NxN matrix b is length N and all elements are used. So for row 0, the first two values are b[0] and c[0]. And for row N-1, the last two values are a[N-1] and b[N-1]. That means that a[0] is not actually on the matrix and is therefore never used, and same with c[N-1].

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix.a
member.summary: The values for the sub-diagonal. a[0] is never used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix.b
member.summary: The values for the main diagonal.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix.c
member.summary: The values for the super-diagonal. c[c.Length-1] is never used.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.LinearAlgebra.TridiagonalMatrix.Solve(System.Double[])
member.summary: Solve the system of equations this*x=d given the specified d.
member.exception: The input d is not the same size as this matrix.
member.remarks: Uses the Thomas algorithm described in the wikipedia article: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tridiagonal_matrix_algorithm Not optimized. Not destructive.

member.summary: Produce a string representation of the contents of this matrix.
member.param: Optional. For String.Format. Must include the colon. Examples are ':0.000' and ',5:0.00'

member.summary: Produce a string representation of the contents of this matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ImageWidth
member.summary: The number of columns of image data, equal to the number of pixels per row.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ImageLength
member.summary: The number of rows of image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.BitsPerSample
member.summary: The number of bits per image component. In this standard each component of the image is 8 bits, so the value for this tag is 8.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Compression
member.summary: The compression scheme used for the image data. When a primary image is JPEG compressed, this designation is not necessary and is omitted.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ImageDescription
member.summary: A character string giving the title of the image. It may be a comment such as "1988 company picnic" or the like.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Make
member.summary: The manufacturer of the recording equipment. This is the manufacturer of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Model
member.summary: The model name or model number of the equipment. This is the model name or number of the DSC, scanner, video digitizer or other equipment that generated the image. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Orientation
member.summary: The image orientation viewed in terms of rows and columns.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SamplesPerPixel
member.summary: The number of components per pixel. Since this standard applies to RGB and YCbCr images, the value set for this tag is 3.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.XResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageWidth direction. When the image resolution is unknown, 72 [dpi] is designated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.YResolution
member.summary: The number of pixels per ResolutionUnit in the ImageLength direction. The same value as XResolution is designated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.PlanarConfiguration
member.summary: Indicates whether pixel components are recorded in a chunky or planar format. If this field does not exist, the TIFF default of 1 (chunky) is assumed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ResolutionUnit
member.summary: The unit for measuring XResolution and YResolution. The same unit is used for both XResolution and YResolution. If the image resolution is unknown, 2 (inches) is designated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.TransferFunction
member.summary: A transfer function for the image, described in tabular style. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the color space information ColorSpace tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Software
member.summary: This tag records the name and version of the software or firmware of the camera or image input device used to generate the image. The detailed format is not specified, but it is recommended that the example shown below be followed. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.DateTime
member.summary: The date and time of image creation. In Exif standard, it is the date and time the file was changed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Artist
member.summary: This tag records the name of the camera owner, photographer or image creator. The detailed format is not specified, but it is recommended that the information be written as in the example below for ease of Interoperability. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown. Ex.) "Camera owner, John Smith; Photographer, Michael Brown; Image creator, Ken James"

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.WhitePoint
member.summary: The chromaticity of the white point of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since color space is specified in the colorspace information ColorSpace tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.PrimaryChromaticities
member.summary: The chromaticity of the three primary colors of the image. Normally this tag is not necessary, since colorspace is specified in the colorspace information ColorSpace tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.YCbCrCoefficients
member.summary: The matrix coefficients for transformation from RGB to YCbCr image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.YCbCrSubSampling
member.summary: The sampling ratio of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.YCbCrPositioning
member.summary: The position of chrominance components in relation to the luminance component. This field is designated only for JPEG compressed data or uncompressed YCbCr data. The TIFF default is 1 (centered); but when Y:Cb:Cr = 4:2:2 it is recommended in this standard that 2 (co-sited) be used to record data, in order to improve the image quality when viewed on TV systems. When this field does not exist, the reader shall assume the TIFF default. In the case of Y:Cb:Cr = 4:2:0, the TIFF default (centered) is recommended. If the reader does not have the capability of supporting both kinds of YCbCrPositioning, it shall follow the TIFF default regardless of the value in this field. It is preferable that readers " be able to support both centered and co-sited positioning.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ReferenceBlackWhite
member.summary: The reference black point value and reference white point value. No defaults are given in TIFF, but the values below are given as defaults here. The color space is declared in a color space information tag, with the default being the value that gives the optimal image characteristics Interoperability these conditions

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Copyright
member.summary: Copyright information. In this standard the tag is used to indicate both the photographer and editor copyrights. It is the copyright notice of the person or organization claiming rights to the image. The Interoperability copyright statement including date and rights should be written in this field; e.g., "Copyright, John Smith, 19xx. All rights reserved.". In this standard the field records both the photographer and editor copyrights, with each recorded in a separate part of the statement. When there is a clear distinction between the photographer and editor copyrights, these are to be written in the order of photographer followed by editor copyright, separated by NULL (in this case since the statement also ends with a NULL, there are two NULL codes). When only the photographer copyright is given, it is terminated by one NULL code . When only the editor copyright is given, the photographer copyright part consists of one space followed by a terminating NULL code, then the editor copyright is given. When the field is left blank, it is treated as unknown.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ExposureProgram
member.summary: The class of the program used by the camera to set exposure when the picture is taken.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SpectralSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the spectral sensitivity of each channel of the camera used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.PhotographicSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the ISO Speed and ISO Latitude of the camera or input device as specified in ISO 12232.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.OECF
member.summary: Indicates the Opto-Electric Conversion Function (OECF) specified in ISO 14524.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.DateTimeOriginal
member.summary: The date and time when the original image data was generated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.CompressedBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Specific to compressed data; states the compressed bits per pixel.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubjectDistance
member.summary: The distance to the subject, given in meters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Flash
member.summary: Indicates the status of flash when the image was shot.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FocalLength
member.summary: The actual focal length of the lens, in mm.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubjectArea
member.summary: This tag indicates the location and area of the main subject in the overall scene.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.MakerNote
member.summary: A tag for manufacturers of Exif writers to record any desired information. The contents are up to the manufacturer, but this tag should not be used for any other than its intended purpose.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.UserComment
member.summary: A tag for Exif users to write keywords or comments on the image besides those in ImageDescription, and without the character code limitations of the ImageDescription tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubsecTime
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTime tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubsecTimeOriginal
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeOriginal tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubsecTimeDigitized
member.summary: A tag used to record fractions of seconds for the DateTimeDigitized tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FlashpixVersion
member.summary: The Flashpix format version supported by a FPXR file.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ColorSpace
member.summary: The color space information tag (ColorSpace) is always recorded as the color space specifier.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FlashEnergy
member.summary: Indicates the strobe energy at the time the image is captured, as measured in Beam Candle Power Seconds(BCPS).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SpatialFrequencyResponse
member.summary: This tag records the camera or input device spatial frequency table and SFR values in the direction of image width, image height, and diagonal direction, as specified in ISO 12233.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FocalPlaneXResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image width (X) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FocalPlaneYResolution
member.summary: Indicates the number of pixels in the image height (Y) direction per FocalPlaneResolutionUnit on the camera focal plane.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FocalPlaneResolutionUnit
member.summary: Indicates the unit for measuring FocalPlaneXResolution and FocalPlaneYResolution. This value is the same as the ResolutionUnit.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubjectLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location of the main subject in the scene. The value of this tag represents the pixel at the center of the main subject relative to the left edge, prior to rotation processing as per the Rotation tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ExposureIndex
member.summary: Indicates the exposure index selected on the camera or input device at the time the image is captured.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SensingMethod
member.summary: Indicates the image sensor type on the camera or input device.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SceneType
member.summary: Indicates the type of scene. If a DSC recorded the image, this tag value shall always be set to 1, indicating that the image was directly photographed.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.CFAPattern
member.summary: Indicates the color filter array (CFA) geometric pattern of the image sensor when a one-chip color area sensor is used. It does not apply to all sensing methods.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.CustomRendered
member.summary: This tag indicates the use of special processing on image data, such as rendering geared to output. When special processing is performed, the reader is expected to disable or minimize any further processing.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ExposureMode
member.summary: This tag indicates the exposure mode set when the image was shot. In auto-bracketing mode, the camera shoots a series of frames of the same scene at different exposure settings.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.WhiteBalance
member.summary: This tag indicates the white balance mode set when the image was shot.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.DigitalZoomRatio
member.summary: This tag indicates the digital zoom ratio when the image was shot. If the numerator of the recorded value is 0, this indicates that digital zoom was not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.FocalLengthIn35MmFilm
member.summary: This tag indicates the equivalent focal length assuming a 35mm film camera, in mm. A value of 0 means the focal length is unknown. Note that this tag differs from the FocalLength tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SceneCaptureType
member.summary: This tag indicates the type of scene that was shot. It can also be used to record the mode in which the image was shot.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GainControl
member.summary: This tag indicates the degree of overall image gain adjustment.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Contrast
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of contrast processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Saturation
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of saturation processing applied by the camera when the image was shot.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.Sharpness
member.summary: This tag indicates the direction of sharpness processing applied by the camera when the image was shot

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.DeviceSettingDescription
member.summary: This tag indicates information on the picture-taking conditions of a particular camera model. The tag is used only to indicate the picture-taking conditions in the reader.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.SubjectDistanceRange
member.summary: This tag indicates the distance to the subject.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude is north or south latitude.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude. The latitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If latitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude is east or west longitude.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude. The longitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If longitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be ddd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSAltitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates the altitude used as the reference altitude. If the reference is sea level and the altitude is above sea level, 0 is given. If the altitude is below sea level, a value of 1 is given and the altitude is indicated as an absolute value in the GPSAltitude tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSAltitude
member.summary: Indicates the altitude based on the reference in GPSAltitudeRef. Altitude is expressed as one RATIONAL value. The reference unit is meters.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSTimestamp
member.summary: Indicates the time as UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). TimeStamp is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the hour, minute, and second.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSSatellites
member.summary: Indicates the GPS satellites used for measurements. This tag can be used to describe the number of satellites, their ID number, angle of elevation, azimuth, SNR and other information in ASCII notation. The format is not specified. If the GPS receiver is incapable of taking measurements, value of the tag shall be set to NULL.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver when the image is recorded.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSMeasureMode
member.summary: Indicates the GPS measurement mode. - 2- or 3- dimensional.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDOP
member.summary: Indicates the GPS DOP (data degree of precision). An HDOP value is written during two-dimensional measurement, and PDOP during three-dimensional measurement.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSSpeedRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the GPS receiver speed of movement. 'K' 'M' and 'N' represents kilometers per hour, miles per hour, and knots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSSpeed
member.summary: Indicates the speed of GPS receiver movement.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSTrackRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of GPS receiver movement. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSTrack
member.summary: Indicates the direction of GPS receiver movement. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSImgDirectionRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference for giving the direction of the image when it is captured. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSImgDirection
member.summary: Indicates the direction of the image when it was captured. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSMapDatum
member.summary: Indicates the geodetic survey data used by the GPS receiver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestLatitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the latitude of the destination point is north or south latitude. The ASCII value 'N' indicates north latitude, and 'S' is south latitude.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestLatitude
member.summary: Indicates the latitude of the destination point. The latitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If latitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be dd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be dd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestLongitudeRef
member.summary: Indicates whether the longitude of the destination point is east or west longitude. ASCII 'E' indicates east longitude, and 'W' is west longitude.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestLongitude
member.summary: Indicates the longitude of the destination point. The longitude is expressed as three RATIONAL values giving the degrees, minutes, and seconds, respectively. If longitude is expressed as degrees, minutes and seconds, a typical format would be ddd/1,mm/1,ss/1. When degrees and minutes are used and, for example, fractions of minutes are given up to two decimal places, the format would be ddd/1,mmmm/100,0/1.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestBearingRef
member.summary: Indicates the reference used for giving the bearing to the destination point. 'T' denotes true direction and 'M' is magnetic direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestBearing
member.summary: Indicates the bearing to the destination point. The range of values is from 0.00 to 359.99.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestDistanceRef
member.summary: Indicates the unit used to express the distance to the destination point. 'K', 'M' and 'N' represent kilometers, miles and knots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDestDistance
member.summary: Indicates the distance to the destination point.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSProcessingMethod
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the method used for location finding. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the method.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSAreaInformation
member.summary: A character string recording the name of the GPS area. The first byte indicates the character code used, and this is followed by the name of the GPS area.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDateStamp
member.summary: A character string recording date and time information relative to UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). The format is YYYY:MM:DD.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.GPSDifferential
member.summary: Indicates whether differential correction is applied to the GPS receiver.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.StripOffsets
member.summary: For each strip, the byte offset of that strip. It is recommended that this be selected so the number of strip bytes does not exceed 64 Kbytes. Aux tag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.JPEGInterchangeFormat
member.summary: The offset to the start byte (SOI) of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.JPEGInterchangeFormatLength
member.summary: The number of bytes of JPEG compressed thumbnail data. This is not used for primary image JPEG data. JPEG thumbnails are not divided but are recorded as a continuous JPEG bitstream from SOI to EOI. Appn and COM markers should not be recorded. Compressed thumbnails must be recorded in no more than 64 Kbytes, including all other data to be recorded in APP1.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ExifIfdPointer
member.summary: A pointer to the Exif IFD. Interoperability, Exif IFD has the same structure as that of the IFD specified in TIFF. ordinarily, however, it does not contain image data as in the case of TIFF.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.RowsPerStrip
member.summary: The number of rows per strip. This is the number of rows in the image of one strip when an image is divided into strips.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.StripByteCounts
member.summary: The total number of bytes in each strip.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.PixelXDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid width of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag, whether or not there is padding data or a restart marker.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.PixelYDimension
member.summary: Information specific to compressed data. When a compressed file is recorded, the valid height of the meaningful image shall be recorded in this tag

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.StandardOutputSensitivity
member.summary: Indicates standard output sensitivity of camera

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ISOSpeed
member.summary: Information about iso speed value as defined in ISO 12232

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ISOSpeedLatitudeYYY
member.summary: This tag indicates ISO speed latitude yyy value as defined in ISO 12232

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.ISOSpeedLatitudeZZZ
member.summary: This tag indicates ISO speed latitude zzz value as defined in ISO 12232

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Exif.ExifProperties.LensModel
member.summary: This tag records lens`s model name and model number

member.summary: This tag records the serial number of interchangable lens

member.summary: This tag notes minimum focal length, maximum focal length, minimum F number in the minimum focal length and minimum F number in maximum focal length

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Jpeg.DCT.ForwardDCT.Initialize
member.summary: Initialize for a processing pass. Verify that all referenced Q-tables are present, and set up the divisor table for each one. In the current implementation, DCT of all components is done during the first pass, even if only some components will be output in the first scan. Hence all components should be examined here.

member.summary: Perform forward DCT on one or more blocks of a component. The input samples are taken from the sample_data[] array starting at position start_row/start_col, and moving to the right for any additional blocks. The quantized coefficients are returned in coef_blocks[].

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrushBase
member.summary: Represents a with base path gradient functionality.
member.remarks: Note that when creating the class it should be initialized with 2 points at least. The internal path created will always be a closed figure, the last point connects the first point. That shape is filled with this . The GDI+ implementation throws an when passing in empty arrays or points set having the same coordinates. The throws an exception when points array contain less than 2 points, the is thrown rather than when points array is unacceptable. The center point is calculated as a center of mass for the passed in points by default. A user can change this point later. The focus scales is an empty point (0.0, 0.0) by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.GifOptions.DoPaletteCorrection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether palette correction is applied.
member.value: true if palette correction is applied; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Palette correction means that whenever image is exported to GIF the source image colors will be analyzed in order to build the best matching palette (in case image Palette does not exist or not specified in the options). The analyze process takes some time however the output image will have the best matching color palette and result is visually better.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.GifOptions.ColorResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the GIF color resolution.
member.remarks: Color Resolution - Number of bits per primary color available to the original image, minus 1. This value represents the size of the entire palette from which the colors in the graphic were selected, not the number of colors actually used in the graphic. For example, if the value in this field is 3, then the palette of the original image had 4 bits per primary color available to create the image. This value should be set to indicate the richness of the original palette, even if not every color from the whole palette is available on the source machine.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.GifOptions.IsPaletteSorted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether palette entries are sorted.
member.value: true if palette entries are sorted; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.GifOptions.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the GIF pixel aspect ratio.
member.remarks: Pixel Aspect Ratio - Factor used to compute an approximation of the aspect ratio of the pixel in the original image. If the value of the field is not 0, this approximation of the aspect ratio is computed based on the formula: Aspect Ratio = (Pixel Aspect Ratio + 15) / 64 The Pixel Aspect Ratio is defined to be the quotient of the pixel's width over its height. The value range in this field allows specification of the widest pixel of 4:1 to the tallest pixel of 1:4 in increments of 1/64th. Values : 0 - No aspect ratio information is given. 1..255 - Value used in the computation.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.GifOptions.HasTrailer

member.value: true if GIF has trailer; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.TiffOptions
member.summary: The tiff file format options. Note that width and height tags will get overwritten on image creation by width and height parameters so there is no need to specify them directly. Note that many options return a default value but that does not mean that this option is set explicitly as a tag value. To verify the tag is present use Tags property or the corresponding IsTagPresent method.
member.developer_tip: WARNING! never modify tiff options during save since this may cause side effects and hard to find bugs. The following line was specially left commented since it caused incorrect determination of data beginning. The passed options did not contain spp (although the options are not correct in such case but still this scenario causes errors) and the next line caused +spp tag +bpp tag added and when options were written after data completely written they have overwritten the data beginning for uncompressed codec!!! See TiffUncompressedCodec.Encode. this.Options.SamplesPerPixel = 3;

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.TiffOptions.Validate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates if options have valid combination of tags
member.param: if set to true suppresses exceptions.
member.exception: The palette tiff images require samples per pixels to be equal 1. or The palette tiff images require ColorMap to be defined. Use ColorMap or Palette property to specify the ColorMap. or The palette tiff images require ColorMap length corresponding to the followign formula: 3 * (2**BitsPerSample). or The samples per pixel are invalid. Samples per pixels should be at least 3 for RGB images. or or For compression + this.Compression + expected 1 sample per pixel. or For compression + this.Compression + the photometric should be MinIsWhite or MinIsBlack only. or For compression + this.Compression + expected 1 bit per sample. or

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Loaders.TiffLoader.CorrectStripByteCounts(Aspose.Imaging.ImageOptions.TiffOptions,Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Tiff.FileManagement.TiffStream,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: This method estimates the correct strip byte counts in case the values for byte counts is zero.
member.param: The start of the current image directory.
The index of the next image directory.
member.remarks: In case tiff encoder have not put the correct byte counts we need to estimate the possible values. This method is simplified in order to get the highest possible performance, for more correct estimation we need to calculate the free blocks during each tag loading and that would cause a lot of performance drop for large images with lots of tags. The simplification is assumption that strip data is contained between 2 continuous IFD blocks and all additional data the tags require contained between the tags definition and the next IFD marker, similar to the following layouts: Tags count | Tag 1 | Tag 2 | ... | Tag n | unknown data, free block | tag 1 additional data | tag 2 additional data | ... | tag n additional data | new IFD | ------ or ----- Tags count | Tag 1 | Tag 2 | ... | Tag n | tag 1 additional data | tag 2 additional data | ... | tag n additional data | unknown data, free block | new IFD | The method works properly if unknown data (free data, probably strip bytes) is according to the above layout. In other case the method will not estimate the strip bytes value correctly. Please note this method is ported from LibTiff and behaves similarly (with some little assumptions) and if this method fails to estimate the correct strip byte counts the LibTiff (and all based decoders) will fail to load the tiff properly. So for most tiff images we will not see any images with tag layout other than specified above and they will be properly processed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Defines the compression method used for image data.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.Raw
member.summary: No compression. The image data stored as raw bytes in RGBA planar order. That means that first all R data is written, then all G is written, then all B and finally all A data is written.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.FileFormats.Psd.CompressionMethod.RLE
member.summary: RLE compressed the image data starts with the byte counts for all the scan lines (rows * channels), with each count stored as a two-byte value. The RLE compressed data follows, with each scan line compressed separately. The RLE compression is the same compression algorithm used by the Macintosh ROM routine PackBits and the TIFF standard.

member.summary: A pattern of lines on a diagonal from upper left to lower right.

member.summary: A pattern of crisscross diagonal lines.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent10
member.summary: Specifies a 10-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 10:90.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent20
member.summary: Specifies a 20-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 20:80.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent25
member.summary: Specifies a 25-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 25:75.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent30
member.summary: Specifies a 30-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 30:70.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent40
member.summary: Specifies a 40-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 40:60.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent50
member.summary: Specifies a 50-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 50:50.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent60
member.summary: Specifies a 60-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 60:40.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent70
member.summary: Specifies a 70-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 70:30.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent75
member.summary: Specifies a 75-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 75:25.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent80
member.summary: Specifies a 80-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 80:100.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Percent90
member.summary: Specifies a 90-percent hatch. The ratio of foreground color to background color is 90:10.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LightDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than ForwardDiagonal, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LightUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points and are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, but they are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DarkDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than, and are twice the width of ForwardDiagonal. This hatch pattern is not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DarkUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, are spaced 50 percent closer together than BackwardDiagonal, and are twice its width, but the lines are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.WideDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the right from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style ForwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.WideUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies diagonal lines that slant to the left from top points to bottom points, have the same spacing as hatch style BackwardDiagonal, and are triple its width, but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LightVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LightHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.NarrowVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Vertical (or 25 percent closer together than LightVertical).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.NarrowHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 75 percent closer together than hatch style Horizontal (or 25 percent closer together than LightHorizontal).

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DarkVertical
member.summary: Specifies vertical lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Vertical and are twice its width.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DarkHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are spaced 50 percent closer together than Horizontal and are twice the width of Horizontal.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DashedDownwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DashedUpwardDiagonal
member.summary: Specifies dashed diagonal lines, that slant to the left from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.SmallConfetti
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of confetti.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LargeConfetti
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of confetti, and is composed of larger pieces than SmallConfetti.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.ZigZag
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are composed of zigzags.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Wave
member.summary: Specifies horizontal lines that are composed of tildes.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DiagonalBrick
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of layered bricks that slant to the left from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.HorizontalBrick
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of horizontally layered bricks.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Weave
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a woven material.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Plaid
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a plaid material.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Divot
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of divots.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DottedGrid
member.summary: Specifies horizontal and vertical lines, each of which is composed of dots, that cross.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.DottedDiamond
member.summary: Specifies forward diagonal and backward diagonal lines, each of which is composed of dots, that cross.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Shingle
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of diagonally layered shingles that slant to the right from top points to bottom points.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Trellis
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a trellis.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.Sphere
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of spheres laid adjacent to one another.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.SmallGrid
member.summary: Specifies horizontal and vertical lines that cross and are spaced 50 percent closer together than hatch style Cross.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.SmallCheckerBoard
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.LargeCheckerBoard
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard with squares that are twice the size of SmallCheckerBoard.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.OutlinedDiamond
member.summary: Specifies forward diagonal and backward diagonal lines that cross but are not antialiased.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.HatchStyle.SolidDiamond
member.summary: Specifies a hatch that has the appearance of a checkerboard placed diagonally.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.ImageAttributes
member.summary: An object contains information about how bitmap and metafile colors are manipulated during rendering. An object maintains several color-adjustment settings, including color-adjustment matrices, grayscale-adjustment matrices, gamma-correction values, color-map tables, and color-threshold values. During rendering, colors can be corrected, darkened, lightened, and removed. To apply such manipulations, initialize an object and pass the path of that object (along with the path of an ) to the DrawImage method.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix
member.remarks: Most algorithms taken from Sun's AffineTransform.java. Java's names for matrix elements used internally. Map of java names to .net ones to description: m00 M11 Scale X m10 M12 Shear Y m01 M21 Shear X m11 M22 Scale Y m02 M31 Translate X m12 M32 Translate Y

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeUnknown
member.summary: This constant is only useful for the cached type field. It indicates that the type has been decached and must be recalculated.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeIdentity
member.summary: An identity transform is one in which the output coordinates are always the same as the input coordinates. If this transform is anything other than the identity transform, the type will either be the constant GENERAL_TRANSFORM or a combination of the appropriate flag bits for the various coordinate conversions that this transform performs.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeTranslation
member.summary: A translation moves the coordinates by a constant amount in x and y without changing the length or angle of vectors.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeUniformScale
member.summary: A uniform scale multiplies the length of vectors by the same amount in both the x and y directions without changing the angle between vectors. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeGeneralScale flag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeGeneralScale
member.summary: A general scale multiplies the length of vectors by different amounts in the x and y directions without changing the angle between perpendicular vectors. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeUniformScale flag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeMaskScale
member.summary: This constant is a bit mask for any of the scale flag bits.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeFlip
member.summary: This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a mirror image flip about some axis which changes the normally right handed coordinate system into a left handed system in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A right handed coordinate system is one where the positive X axis rotates counterclockwise to overlay the positive Y axis similar to the direction that the fingers on your right hand curl when you stare end on at your thumb. A left handed coordinate system is one where the positive X axis rotates clockwise to overlay the positive Y axis similar to the direction that the fingers on your left hand curl. There is no mathematical way to determine the angle of the original flipping or mirroring transformation since all angles of flip are identical given an appropriate adjusting rotation. NOTE: TypeFlip was added after GENERAL_TRANSFORM was in public circulation and the flag bits could no longer be conveniently renumbered without introducing binary incompatibility in outside code.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeQuadrantRotation
member.summary: This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a quadrant rotation by some multiple of 90 degrees in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A rotation changes the angles of vectors by the same amount regardless of the original direction of the vector and without changing the length of the vector. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the TypeGeneralRotation flag.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeGeneralRotation
member.summary: This flag bit indicates that the transform defined by this object performs a rotation by an arbitrary angle in addition to the conversions indicated by other flag bits. A rotation changes the angles of vectors by the same amount regardless of the original direction of the vector and without changing the length of the vector. This flag bit is mutually exclusive with the

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeMaskRotation
member.summary: This constant is a bit mask for any of the rotation flag bits.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.TypeGeneralTransform
member.summary: This constant indicates that the transform defined by this object performs an arbitrary conversion of the input coordinates. If this transform can be classified by any of the above constants, the type will either be the constant TypeIdentity or a combination of the appropriate flag bits for the various coordinate conversions that this transform performs.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.ApplyIdentity
member.summary: This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that no calculations need to be performed and that the source coordinates only need to be copied to their destinations to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.ApplyTranslate
member.summary: This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the translation components of the matrix (m02 and m12) need to be added to complete the transformation equation of this transform.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.ApplyScale
member.summary: This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the scaling components of the matrix (m00 and m11) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. If the ApplyShear bit is also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not both 0.0. If the ApplyShear bit is not also set then it indicates that the scaling components are not both 1.0. If neither the ApplyShear nor the ApplyScale bits are set then the scaling components are both 1.0, which means that the x and y components contribute to the transformed coordinate, but they are not multiplied by any scaling factor.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.ApplyShear
member.summary: This constant is used for the internal state variable to indicate that the shearing components of the matrix (m01 and m10) need to be factored in to complete the transformation equation of this transform. The presence of this bit in the state variable changes the interpretation of the ApplyScale bit as indicated in its documentation.

member.summary: The X coordinate scaling element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.m01
member.summary: The X coordinate shearing element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.m11
member.summary: The Y coordinate scaling element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.Matrix.m12
member.summary: The Y coordinate of the translation element of the 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

members.member:
Manually recalculates the state of the transform when the matrix changes too much to predict the effects on the state. The following table specifies what the various settings of the state field say about the values of the corresponding matrix element fields. Note that the rules governing the SCALE fields are slightly different depending on whether the SHEAR flag is also set.
SCALE SHEAR TRANSLATE m00/m11 m01/m10 m02/m12
IDENTITY 1.0 0.0 0.0 TRANSLATE (TR) 1.0 0.0 not both 0.0 SCALE (SC) not both 1.0 0.0 0.0 TR | SC not both 1.0 0.0 not both 0.0 SHEAR (SH) 0.0 not both 0.0 0.0 TR | SH 0.0 not both 0.0 not both 0.0 SC | SH not both 0.0 not both 0.0 0.0 TR | SC | SH not both 0.0 not both 0.0 not both 0.0

member.summary: These tables translate the flags during predictable quadrant rotations where the shear and scale values are swapped and negated.

member.value: An array of floating-point values that represents the elements of this .

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrush
member.summary: Encapsulates a object with a gradient. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.para: The center color is white by default. A user can changed this value at any time later.

The surround colors array is initialized by single element containing white color by default. The surround colors may be changed later, however at least single element is required when setting up the surround colors.
See the for more details about its initialization.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrush.SetSigmaBellShape(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a gradient brush that changes color starting from the center of the path outward to the path's boundary. The transition from one color to another is based on a bell-shaped curve.
member.param: A value from 0 through 1 that specifies where, along any radial from the center of the path to the path's boundary, the center color will be at its highest intensity. A value of 1 (the default) places the highest intensity at the center of the path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrush.SetSigmaBellShape(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a gradient brush that changes color starting from the center of the path outward to the path's boundary. The transition from one color to another is based on a bell-shaped curve.
member.param: A value from 0 through 1 that specifies where, along any radial from the center of the path to the path's boundary, the center color will be at its highest intensity. A value of 1 (the default) places the highest intensity at the center of the path.

A value from 0 through 1 that specifies the maximum intensity of the center color that gets blended with the boundary color. A value of 1 causes the highest possible intensity of the center color, and it is the default value.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrush.SetBlendTriangularShape(System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a gradient with a center color and a linear falloff to one surrounding color.
member.param: A value from 0 through 1 that specifies where, along any radial from the center of the path to the path's boundary, the center color will be at its highest intensity. A value of 1 (the default) places the highest intensity at the center of the path.

member.name: M:Aspose.Imaging.Brushes.PathGradientBrush.SetBlendTriangularShape(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a gradient with a center color and a linear falloff to each surrounding color.
member.param: A value from 0 through 1 that specifies where, along any radial from the center of the path to the path's boundary, the center color will be at its highest intensity. A value of 1 (the default) places the highest intensity at the center of the path.

A value from 0 through 1 that specifies the maximum intensity of the center color that gets blended with the boundary color. A value of 1 causes the highest possible intensity of the center color, and it is the default value.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormat.DigitSubstitutionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method to be used for digit substitution.
member.value: A enumeration value that specifies how to substitute characters in a string that cannot be displayed because they are not supported by the current font.
member.remarks: The setter is introduced for the obsolete method SetDigitSubstitution.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormat.DigitSubstitutionLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the language that is used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
member.value: A National Language Support (NLS) language identifier that identifies the language that will be used when local digits are substituted for western digits. You can pass the property of a object as the NLS language identifier. For example, suppose you create a object by passing the string "ar-EG" to a constructor. If you pass the property of that object along with. to the method, then Arabic-Indic digits will be substituted for western digits at display time.
member.remarks: The setter is introduced for the obsolete method SetDigitSubstitution.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormat.FirstTabOffset
member.summary: Gets the number of spaces between the beginning of a line of text and the first tab stop.
member.remarks: The property is introduced for removed method GetTabStops.

member.name: P:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormat.TabStops
member.summary: Gets an array of distances between tab stops in the units specified by the property.
member.remarks: The property is introduced for removed method GetTabStops.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags
member.summary: Specifies the display and layout information for text strings.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.DirectionRightToLeft
member.summary: Text is displayed from right to left.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.FitBlackBox
member.summary: Parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle. By default, characters are repositioned to avoid any overhang.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.DisplayFormatControl
member.summary: Control characters such as the left-to-right mark are shown in the output with a representative glyph.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.NoFontFallback
member.summary: Fallback to alternate fonts for characters not supported in the requested font is disabled. Any missing characters are displayed with the fonts missing glyph, usually an open square.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Includes the trailing space at the end of each line. By default the boundary rectangle returned by the MeasureString method excludes the space at the end of each line. Set this flag to include that space in measurement.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.NoWrap
member.summary: Text wrapping between lines when formatting within a rectangle is disabled. This flag is implied when a point is passed instead of a rectangle, or when the specified rectangle has a zero line length.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.LineLimit
member.summary: Only entire lines are laid out in the formatting rectangle. By default layout continues until the end of the text, or until no more lines are visible as a result of clipping, whichever comes first. Note that the default settings allow the last line to be partially obscured by a formatting rectangle that is not a whole multiple of the line height. To ensure that only whole lines are seen, specify this value and be careful to provide a formatting rectangle at least as tall as the height of one line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringFormatFlags.NoClip
member.summary: Overhanging parts of glyphs, and unwrapped text reaching outside the formatting rectangle are allowed to show. By default all text and glyph parts reaching outside the formatting rectangle are clipped.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming
member.summary: Specifies how to trim characters from a string that does not completely fit into a layout shape.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming.Character
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming.Word
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming.EllipsisCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming.EllipsisWord
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.StringTrimming.EllipsisPath
member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.name: T:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Specifies the quality of text rendering.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.SystemDefault
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap, with the system default rendering hint. The text will be drawn using whatever font-smoothing settings the user has selected for the system.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixelGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is used to improve character appearance on stems and curvature.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.SingleBitPerPixel
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph bitmap. Hinting is not used.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.AntiAliasGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap with hinting. Much better quality due to antialiasing, but at a higher performance cost.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.AntiAlias
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its antialiased glyph bitmap without hinting. Better quality due to antialiasing. Stem width differences may be noticeable because hinting is turned off.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.TextRenderingHint.ClearTypeGridFit
member.summary: Each character is drawn using its glyph ClearType bitmap with hinting. The highest quality setting. Used to take advantage of ClearType font features.

member.summary: Specifies how a texture or gradient is tiled when it is smaller than the area being filled.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.WrapMode.TileFlipX
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient horizontally and then tiles the texture or gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.WrapMode.TileFlipY
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient vertically and then tiles the texture or gradient.

member.name: F:Aspose.Imaging.WrapMode.TileFlipXY
member.summary: Reverses the texture or gradient horizontally and vertically and then tiles the texture or gradient.
